Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, hope your feeling better after your op, Had mine two days ago, I'm feeling sore and bruised, but I'm ok generally Lots of friends round supporting me , as. I live alone, but it's when everyone has gone home, is when it hits you. I was supposed to have a phone call from the BCN yesterday but they didn't call so im a bit annoyed about that.. Anyway take care and hope your appointment goes well Take care Carla xx
Posts.Title: Had my operation

Posts.Content: Hi everyone.. I had my lumpectomy and snb last Monday, waiting results of lymph nodes and grades.. Now my questions are , some stories I read , some have no node involvement and have to have chemo, and some have node involvement and no chemo, just radio and tamoxifen.. Really confused on how they seem to be he same diagnosis but different treatments... Anyone have any idea as to why.. Thanks Carla xx
Posts.Title: Confusing treatments...

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne I'm also still blue, I had my lumpectomy 7 th April, 2 weeks ago but it's now turning a nice shade of green lol , I think it's also a mixture of bruising too , xx
Posts.Title: Need to ask a silly question please

Posts.Content: Hi everyone , hope everyone are all doing ok and had a lovely Easter... 2 weeks ago today I had my lumpectomy, and have my hospital appointment on Thursday for my results and what treatment I'll be having .. My friends mum has breast cancer, and unfortunately it's terminal , so when we all talk about it, I feel a bit strange , like mine isn't important , I don't know if that's me being stupid or would anyone else feel the same , I feel so sorry for my friends mum, as I or anyone else could be or are in the same position .. I just feel like I can't moAn about mine not sure how to feel , as it hasn't really sunk in about my own cancer :( and obviously I'm anxious on my results Thursday Carla xx
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: Strange isn't it... Because I'm "just getting on with it" and recovering from my op , it looks like I'm fine because I don't feel ill , but mentally I'm worried sick.. I know I'll have radiotherapy and probably tamoxifen for 5 yrs but I don't know what else I'll have as yet .. So just with the tablets, they'll put me through the menopaus and god knows what other side effects , I'm actually really worried :(
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, thankyou for that info, it seems a long way off to wait for results, probably the worst part is waiting .. I only know mine is invasive oestrogen receptor positive.. That's all I know at the moment , And I don't even understand that .. I hope they explain it more when I go back as most of you seem to know more than I do at this time .. I hope everyone is doing ok , lots of best wishes Carla xx
Posts.Title: Confusing treatments...

Posts.Content: Thankyou, yeah I'm not sure what they will tell me Thursday, I. Keeping everything crossed for whatever treatment , and a bit worried about the effects of tamoxifen, going through the menopaus , I keep saying things will be back to normal soon , but not sure if things will be the same again x
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying ladies, I thought it was just me being paranoid or "coping well" I've made it all a bit of a joke , but when I'm on my own , it's when it hits me and yes , when you look well and "back to normal" people seem to forget you've been told you have "cancer" because you can't see it like a broken leg , and I feel because it's been cut out, then that's the end of it, or so people think ... I'm glad I can talk to people who share the same feelings , obviously not a good thing , but who know how we all feel , thankyou xx
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: So glad I have you lovely people to talk to xx
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: I'm new to the group, Just been diagnosed with invasive Bc also oestrogen receptor positive .. Having a lumpectomy on 7 t April with radiation therapy.. Not sure what else to expect and not sure how worried I should be .. Any advice would be appreciated ..xx
Posts.Title: Headaches on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi everyone , I think I'm a bit down today, it's been such a roller coaster , being told I had Bc and the op, and results Thursday, I think I've only just sat down and thought how serious this all is ... I've been a bit blas√© about it all, and the hardest thing of all is that I couldn't even tell my mum .. Because I would be worrying about how worried she would be and have enough to worry about all this.. not sure if I'm just hormonal or if it's all a bit too much now..xx

hi , yeah it's hard isn't it, and I live alone , so too much time to think about things , so it's probably better I do go back to work , and I'll take it easy as much as I can , and I'm sure everyone will help out , xx

Hi mistymoley I thought I'd had a break as I've just had 2 weeks off work after the lumpectomy, and planned to go back to,work tomorrow , but to be honest , I don't think I'm ready, I'm still sore and tender, and I'm a hairdresser , not sure what to do ... I own the salon and can't keep affording all the extra staff .. Don't know what to do xx

Yeah it has perks sometimes being the boss, but with all this going on its a bit of a worry too.. having to pay extra staff to work , and with me not being there some customers may go elsewhere, but it's only been a few weeks so I'm back to work now , and all being well , I hope to stay that way .. I'm tired tonight too myself, so ive had a takeaway and bed early , , hope you sleep better tonight and have a great weeknd xx
Hi marg Hope your all ok and surgery went well, And not too much pain , lots of best wishes to you xx
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi allme, It's been great getting back to work , Not lifting anything as still tender , but Makes you feel like things are getting back to normal , Customers have been great too.. I've been tired today , but maybe that was the wine last night :). I just hope my her2 result comes back negative , and then I can get radio out the way and start tamoxifen... how's are you doing ..xx

Hi hill point Yes it does seem like your in a bubble, and not real, I had the one lumpectomy and node removal , still tender and have some numbness in upper arm inside , so feels sensitive . My mum is I'll herself and that's why I haven't told her yet. I'm still waiting on her2 results to see if I have to have chemo and herceptin .. I'm praying I don't have to, I am back at work and trying to pick up the pieces and that will be a big blow if I have to ... I'm a hairdresser and have my own little salon , and can't even think about the effects it will have on the salon , and I know my health is most important , but I have all these other matters to worry about too... Are you on herceptin too ? How is your chemo? I know not pleasant and. Ant even imagine what it's like , I wish you all the best too with your recovery xx

Hi Yvonne, Hope your ok, I'm 3 weeks post op, I'm back at work as a hairdresser last couple of days, but I feel like it's too soon, I'm still in pain and very tender, I carried shopping bags home yesterday as no car, and now I am in pain today , but I don't have anyone to do it for me .. I'm a very independant person and can't wait to be back to "me " again.. I'm still waiting on. HER2 result and praying to god it's negative so I don't have to have chemo .. I. Just starting to get my life back after the op and diagnosis , even tho it's early days , not sure if I feel he same ever again but trying to . So chemo would be a huge step backwards for me .. I know it is for my best interests and my life, and I'm sure we could all do without all this in our lives, but I know how you are feeling ... I hope you feel better soon , and get back to "you " again real soon xx
Posts.Title: When will I be "ME" again ???

Posts.Content: Hi there I'm also new cancer patient , got diagnosed about 4 weeks ago, invasive oestrogen receptor positive (whatever that means) had lumpectomy Monday with snb .. I'm now awaiting results in two weeks.. very new to this and I'm also an active person , work full time, gym, disabled mum I look after, but now all this to deal with... So one day at a time.. Good luck with the results. Here's hoping hey are clear for you and get back to normal life again xx
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi everyone .. I am now radioactive lol and had the X .. Just the waiting around now .. Thankyou all so much for the well wishes and support.. Will let you know how it goes.. Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Op day at last...

Posts.Content: The day has finally arrived to have this Nasty little lump removed... Have to be there for 7.30 and can't sleep .. Well at least I can sleep later. Any advice for me post op .. Thanks everyone xx
Posts.Title: Op day at last...

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I'm home and resting, had lots of visitors ,some great friends, and I'm having a catch up of Corrie :) it's all good so far, a bit of pain, but bearable... Now for the two week wait for results , but I'm not going to worry too much .. Thanks for everyone's words of advice and support.. Carla xx
Posts.Title: Op day at last...

Posts.Content: Hi hally12. How did your op go, hoping your recovering well , not too bad, I take it you had the masectomy :(. How is everything going , xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for results

Posts.Content: Hi everyone , haven't been on here since last week as had a lovely weekend away to get away from it all, until my treatment starts , whatever that May be... I had my lumpectomy 7 th April, and appointment with consultant to tell me it hadn't spread to my lymph nodes .. But , we're still waiting on the HER2 results, and they can't give me an appointment with oncologist until we get that result first as we don't know treatment plan until that result ... Really frustrating. As I'm getting over the op and been back at work 2 weeks after my op, so everything seems to be going fine , so I'm dreading this result as it could mean chemo or just rads , Has anyone waited this long for the HER2 result ..? Thanks Hope everyone is feeling good, and there ops went well ... Xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for results

Posts.Content: Hi allme. I'm lucky enough to have my own barber shop , so have had people,working for me, but it's still hard to pay more money out as only been open 11 months and only just covering bills , it's hard as I live alone so no partner to support me either , but on a positive note, self employment gives you the freedom and opportunity to be your own boss with your own flexible hours of work , and no boss to tell you you have to go back to work , good luck whatever you decide xx
Posts.Title: job v self employed as shattered n stressed all the time!

Posts.Content: Hi. I'm also new to the group, have my op on Monday 7 th , had all those feelings you have , one minute I'm ok and the next I'm tearful, and also very tired, but I'm at work everyday, smiling to my customers, acting like nothing is wrong. But at the back of my mind is the C word.. All I'm waiting for is my op , and fingers crossed all goes well.. And good luck to Yvonne for her op tomorrow, and everyone else on this site who needs a lot of well wishes.. Xx
Posts.Title: Weird & Wobbly

Posts.Content: Glad your getting pain relief sorted, I had dressing changed today , had to go to gp surgery, I'm a bit worn out tonight as I went to my salon to get my greasy mop washed lol .. But feel a bit better just getting hair washed ... It's gonna be a long wait until 24 th April for results xx
Posts.Title: Second hurdle over :)

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, sorry to hear you had more surgery, had my op Monday and now waiting for results to see if mine also have spread to lymph nodes.. I'm keeping everything crossed.. Hope you feel better soon xx
Posts.Title: Second hurdle over :)

Posts.Content: Thankyou for replying , I will try and work this forum out and join it :) yes, it's so sad to see so many are in the same boat , but all giving each other support and advice is amazing .. Xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Yvonne.. Good luck for your op on Wednesday.. I've been given the same treatment plan lumpectomy, nodes and radiotherapy, so all going well , we will have this nasty little lump out pretty soon :) Carla xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Hi hallie They have told me I'll expect to have 3 weeks of radiotherapy, and most probably have tablets after that .. Don't really understand any of it, but next Monday can't come quick enough for me.. They gave me a date for op when I got the results from biopsy , I hope you get a date as soon as possible xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Oh no.. How come you had MRI scan before your op ? My lump is also small, and I'm dreading the results after the op ... It's quite frightening to think a small lump can do so much damage.. I bet your head is spinning, it's all a bit much to take in, I'm still shocked at my diagnosis too.. We are all on here to give support , as no one can understand what it's really like unless your going through it yourself xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Hi , I've just been diagnosed wih breast cancer.. I have been given my date for a lumpectomy , and they will take a couple of nodes out too... They said I'll have 3 weeks of radiotherapy.. Won't know any more than this until after the operation.. All a bit strange, as it doesn't seem real ..
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Bless you.. At least I don't have children to think about , and I'm single now, so I don't have anyone to worry about apart from family .. But would be nice to have a partner to support me . Well , let's hope and pray you get the best outcome your wishing for, I feel like I'm looking in from afar, it just doesn't seem real for me.. I'm working and living but it's like life's on hold until this nasty thing goes away . Take care and everything crossed , and try and enjoy your family time together :) xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Hi hally Yes my op date is next Monday 7 th April .. Lumpectomy and nodes. They've told me I'll have radiotherapy, but I won't know of any further treatment until after the two week wait .. Nervous but I don't want to think the worse.. Have you been given a date for surgery yet ? Carla xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment

Posts.Content: Hi penny r Everyone knows exactly how your feeling right now , I had my lumpectomy 7th April, and 3 nodes removed , still feel a bit tender and sore after 3 weeks , and can't lift anything, but I'm back at work now , and waiting for oncologist appointment for m treatment plan, Everyone on here have been brilliant , and loads of advice and support , Mb77. Hope your feeling. Ok after your op , and good luck jane for next week on your op xx
Posts.Title: scared and angry

Posts.Content: Think I've joined the group properly, well, have the date for my lumpectomy and nodes surgery , 12 days to go.. Any advice on treatment , surgery and being able to work , would be appreciated ... Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment in 12 days...

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, I hope you feel better soon, and make a speedy recovery, im not really worried about the surgery, I think I'm a bit worried if it had gone to the nodes.. Or anywhere else.. I know I have to take it one step at a time but it's all a bit scary as you know. I have a salon, so I'm raising my arms a lot with my job.. so I don't think I'll be going back into work for a few weeks . I'm really glad I found this group, and you can ask anyone anything , and get proper answers as they're the ones going through it all.. , Now you have that nasty little lump out, must be a big weight off your shoulders.. and you too keep us updated with your recovery .. Carla xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment in 12 days...

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone, Some good people on here I'm sure .. I've now organised people to work , so I can relax a bit and concentrate on surgery and getting well... I received my "race for life" pack today, and I really hope I'm fit and well enough to take part.. March 13 th was the worst day of my life to be told I had breast cancer , but I know wi the help from friends and family and you guys , this journey will be a bit easier to cope with.. It makes me sad that there are so many suffering from his awful disease xx
Posts.Title: Start of treatment in 12 days...

Posts.Content: Hi here, just been reading through all these posts, and can't quite believe why on earth you wouldn't want this 12 mm CANCER. Cut out of your healthy body to save your life !!! I had 13 mm tumour removed 2 weeks ago, now waiting on results from my lymph nodes, I'm 45 years old and have a life to live, and if that means being sliced and poisoned and burnt for a few weeks then so be it, .. I know everyone has different opinions , but I'd rather save mine Good luck x
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Lol know that feeling xx
Posts.Title: doh!

Posts.Content: Hi I'm so pleased for you that you've kicked it's butt.. :). I get my results next week , fingers crossed , I'll get tamoxifen and radiotherapy as long as nodes are all clear !! and Amanda, I hope your results have come back clear too, as not seen any posts from you recently .. And George &jackie, I love the poem , can you make one for me please :)))) it's great ! You give everyone so much info and advice, your great ! Lots of love and best wishes Carla xx
Posts.Title: A massive thank you to every one xxxx

Posts.Content: Hi Joanne I had lumpectomy and nodes out 7 April. It was all numb on the inside of my arm and armpit for a few weeks , and even my skin felt sensitive to touch with clothes on , I had a throbbing pain that came and went , also movement in a car would be painful, but I'm 8 weeks down the lien and go for my radiotherapy this week .. Good luck with it all xx
Posts.Title: Sleepless nights

Posts.Content: Was meant to say, it's all feeling fine now, still a little numb around the node removal scar , apart from that it's all fine xx
Posts.Title: Sleepless nights

Posts.Content: Just read the my other post, I saw you was her negative grade 2 11mm Im 45 yrs old , was grade 2, 13mm, invasive , I'm hoping the other test result will be negative , as I'm not sure how I would cope with chemo, just the thought of it xx
Posts.Title: Advice - any much appreciated

Posts.Content: Hi kargus Sorry to hear your results aren't what you wanted .. everyone on here are here to support you and everyone , and everyone has some valuable advice and information to help cope with this nasty desease and treatments .. I'm still waiting for my HER2 result too, it's all the waiting game that's not nice either.. Did you say you are negative or positive for HER2 ? And I also thought I'd done something in my past life as the last couple of years have been crap in some way or another , but this certainly was the worst , good luck with the treatment , we are all on here to chat to on your down days and also your good days too xx
Posts.Title: Advice - any much appreciated

Posts.Content: thankyou xx
Posts.Title: Indexed Terms and Abbreviations Dictionary For Everything BC Related...

Posts.Content: Heyjude Thanks for reply, yes I can understand there are so many different types and treatments, all I know of mine is it's invasive and oestrogen responsive positive, so I'll have to wait to see what happens after surgery, How was the chemo .. Is it as bad as I'm thinking ..? Probably silly question , but if it saves your life, then it must be a good thing right ..? I'm a bit nervous because I can feel two tiny lumps close to armpit , so I'm hoping it isn't swollen nodes Well done you for finishing your treatment, hopefully that's the end of it all for you :) xx
Posts.Title: When and why would you have chemo..

Posts.Content: I'm due to have lumpectomy and nodes removed Monday, is it if the nodes are affected you would have to have chemo.. Bit confused as there are so many different treatments , I know everyone is different, but not sure what to expect , xx
Posts.Title: When and why would you have chemo..

Posts.Content: Thankyou George and jackie All good so far xx
Posts.Title: Op done and now home

Posts.Content: Hi everyone , hope your all having a good weekend.. Well, I had my surgery 7 th April, back at work, went out for a night out Saturday with my friends and had a great time , but everyday , I'm soooo tired.. One of the symptoms Apart from the lump I had before diagnosis was tiredness to the point I didn't want to get out of bed, but I thought I'd have more energy now .. I was ironing yesterday and had to sit down half way through it and chill on the sofa most of the day , really not use to being like this as I'm usually full of energy .. Will I get my energy back !! xx
Posts.Title: Tired

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Well that's one hurdle crossed.. Lump removed and I looked like avatar last night lol a nice shade of blue .. now for the two week wait.. And I have everything crossed for the all clear .. I hope everyone are all doing ok ...xx
Posts.Title: Op done and now home

Posts.Content: hey everyone after a long day , lots of visitors and been spoilt :) My avatar look has gone lol ... Well the pain isn't too bad so it's bearable .. thank you all for being there and supportive .. never met any of you but your all very kind and thoughtful of each other ..xx
Posts.Title: Op done and now home

Posts.Content: Thank you , yeah blue wee lol Yes I have great friends and all are here for me if need them .. xx
Posts.Title: Op done and now home

Posts.Content: Hi, I've been really tired and exhausted for months , and going back to gp for blood tests , then got diagnosed with breast cancer 13 th march .. So I'm putting it down to the cancer, as I'm usually fit and well, and always running round hardly sitting down, so this is very unusual for me to be feeling this exhausted xx
Posts.Title: So tired
